statement.p: In Biology class, students store their specimen's for labs at -24 ˚C. To thaw, a specimen is brought to a refrigeration unit. After 1 hour, the specimen's temperature in the refrigeration unit is -17 ˚C.
a. Sketch a graph to model the situation.
b. Calculate the rate of change. m = degrees per hour
c. The y-intercept is . What does it represent in this situation?

ol.li: It takes 24 minutes to warm up.
The specimen starts at 24 degrees below zero.
The temperature goes up 24 degrees per hour.

ol.li: The temperature goes up 7 degrees per hour.
